column4: use -d option (see apt-get --help for this and other options)

do you use hibernate? I think that the computer gets somewhat slow after the hibernate
in theory at least, hibernation should not impact performance, anything else I would presume is down to bugs...
it used to get slower when I used ubunto 8.04 so I never used it again.
According to what I saw on some linux forums, if you are going to use hibernation then you need to have at least a swap size bigger or equal to your RAM size
yes, since ram is dumped to swapspace, and the recovered when you unfreeze.
I think the only line to change is shiretoko -> firefox , if you edit the default string

and what browser are you using?
then try a user agent switcher to identify it as firefox rather than shiretoko?

I added Firefox to the User Agent, it seems to be working. tks
